results.title: From the bottom to the top
results.creator_credit: Department of Education Queensland, Claire Stapleton, Paul Quinlan and Jim Berkey
results.brief_description: The first part of this tape encourages confidence in the water through familiarization, body awareness and movement in the water. The second part presents a natural progression from water activities to swimming skills.

results.title: From the beginning to the resistances
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Mick Edwards and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Me, my family, my nan - my mob.’ This is Mick Edwards’ story of separation, of a stolen generation or in Edwards’ words, “the kidnapped generation” and of healing and family and reunion.

results.title: From the barrel of a gun
results.creator_credit: Steven Talley, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This video looks at how two men - Ho Chi Minh and Sukharno destroyed the myth of western supremacy by tapping into the innate spirit of nationalism which had been repressed in the peoples of Vietnam and Indonesia. The video mixes archival footage, eyewitness accounts and expert commentary to show the roots of the Vietnamese war and the rise of Indonesia as a political power.

results.title: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.
results.title_for_label: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: From the ashes of war
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Nico Crama and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: This film uses stock shots, photographs, and rare archival film footage to document the liberation of Amsterdam by Canadian troops in May, 1945, and the events preceding it. Some of the worst battles, such as the Battle of the Scheldt and the crossing of the Leopold Canal, are shown. The film is narrated by Alex Colville, internationally known painter, who was an official war artist at the time. The film captures the horror of a people at war and testifies to the strong friendship that developed between Holland and Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Nico Crama and Michael McKennirey

results.title: From the ashes
results.creator_credit: Glenn Silber, International Women's Film Project Productions and Helena Solberg Ladd
results.brief_description: A documentary tracing the history of Nicaragua from the presence of U.S. Marines in the early 1900s, through several rebellions to the problems of the present (up to 1981). The film focuses on the present efforts of the people to rebuild their country. Includes interviews.

results.title: From ten to twelve
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley, Edmund Reid, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
Quite far removed from infancy, yet not across the threshold of adolescence, children of ten to twelve present an absorbing study of adults-in-the-making. We watch the children of one family in various situations in the home, at school and in group play, and find that much of their conflicting behavior is actually a normal part of the growing-up process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith Crawley, Edmund Reid, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
